ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Insight about important middle eastern cinema. It was interesting to compare the different nuances of film in the region
I learned a lot about some canonical films (Salama fi Khayr, Cairo Station), etc. Watched a lot of films. Didn't read a ton of the outside sources, but they were there.
Gained vast layers of insight into cultural implementation of regional trends, more abstract application of concrete realities.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: several interesting movie/ guest speakers
Weaknesses: a lot of movies so difficult to go into much depth.

Strengths: good movies, professor gave good and HONEST feedback

Weaknesses: 9:25 am tiredness, weak class discussion, professor was more into the class than the students were at times

Subject material was interesting, and small class size + emphasis on discussion made for necessarily deep engagement. 

Readings could be improved by favoring direct relevance over breadth

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend if they enjoy analyzing film

Maybe? If you want to watch a lot of Middle East films, this is a good course to do so; however, you should go in with an idea that you won't JUST be watching films. I think I went in thinking that I'd just be watching films, and a lot of the work that I had to do felt tedious as a result.
Yes, definitely. Provided interesting anthropological exercises by exploring the medium of film.

extras.title: FILM 336 01/MMES 311 01/RLST 256 01 - Social Change in ME Cinemas
